intro: Eriosolena montana var. minor, commonly known as the lesser mountain eriosolena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
